content.description:
Stay just right of the chimney (

Room with a View

). Start in a small dihedral left of

Karmic Relief

. The direct finish may be 11c.
content.protection: Bolt anchor.

content.description: Route goes up the center face of the pinnacle that sits directly above Gandalf in New Middle Earth. Start on a juggy flake to a easy mantle followed by a few balancy traversing moves to the top.
content.protection: TR only. Bolt Anchor
content.location: Pinnacle above Gandalf area in New Middle Earth. Easy 4th class on the backside of the formation to establish an anchor.

content.description: Strider is the short 5.6 crack a few feet left of Strider Face.
content.protection: Trad pro.
content.location: Pinnacle above Gandalf area in New Middle Earth. Easy 4th class on the backside of the formation to establish an anchor.

content.description: overhanging juggy start
content.protection: bolt anchor
content.location: 8 feet right of Grandpa's Dihedral

content.description: Climb a slightly overhanging, but also slightly dirty, arete to bolt anchors. A more strenuous climb, but lower quality, than its neighbor "Strider Face."
content.protection: Dos Bolts
content.location: The bolted arete to the right of "Strider Face."

content.description: Climb the left diagonal finger crack just right of Lord of the Rings. Climbing eases once you reach the ledge. Scramble over foliage and belay from the tree. Walk of descent.
content.protection: Standard rack. Gear anchor.

content.description: Facing at the very top of the canyon, start 20 ft left of obvious hand crack Dimrill Stair. climb a thin crack to ledges, then follow a hand crack up and left.
content.protection: Small rack, Gear Anchor
content.location: 20ft. left of Dimrill Stair

content.description: Easy crack climbing on a right facing dihedral abruptly halts at a roof. Pull the roof and continue  up the face following an ever widening flake.
content.protection: Standard rack. Bolt anchor with rap rings.

content.description: Shadowfax is the first climb you come to as you reach Middle Earth heading up from the south start of the climbers loop trail. Shadow Fax is a hand crack that widens to slightly off width as you get near the top. The crux comes near the bottom of the climb where the crack moves slightly right with insecure feet (look to the small cracks to your right for help). The climbing is excellent and is good practice to improve your crack skills. The climb can be top roped by walking around the back of the rock and scrambling up to the anchor. The crack is easily protectable and should be led.
content.protection: .5 to # 3 (a #4 can be used just don't admitt it to anybody). Bolt anchor and rap rings at top of climb.

content.description: This meandering moderate route climbs past four bolts and at least one gear placement. A bolt protects the delicate crux move.
content.protection: Four (4) bolt protection + gear. Standard rack. Two bolt rap anchor.
content.location: This route is located just right of Smeagol's Surprise and 10 feet left of Dimrill Stair.

climbs.name: Room With A View (aka Helm's Deep)

content.description: Room With A View is a chimney that leads to an offwidth.
content.protection: You can cheat and clip one bolt of another climb down low. I brought a #4 and #5 C4, and a #6 really would have been better. Maybe a hex would work well where I stuck the #4. This is not too difficult, but it is heady if you don't own the wide stuff.
content.location:
Start in an obvious cave in the Middle Earth area just left of

Karmic Relief

.

content.description: Will edit with more pertinent info after leading, but on top rope the route was very enjoyable. WIth strong moves off the bat but with positive holds.
content.protection: 4 bolts, Anchor. (?) Dont recall seeing an anchor, but Art's guide lists one.
content.location: Left of Room with a View."new Middle Earth"

content.description: Awkward wide crack. hand/fist, not a lot of offwidth.
content.protection:
Really a #4 right below the crux is all the pro one could need or ask for. If a 4 is not at hand a 3 or 2 will still make for a safe climb.

Build your own anchor up top. Lots of obvious options.
content.location: Far left of Gandalf formation

content.description: Follow the thin crack up the arete to a shallow dihedral.
content.protection: 2 bolts.  Small nuts.

content.description:
Intial tricky move off the deck ( direct 5.9 ) that really makes the route worth doing, with interesting climbing to the anchors.

Combine with Gandalf for great intro to Mission gorge climbing with both face and crack.
content.protection: Mixed lead, 2 bolts. 2 Bolt anchor. Walk-off.
content.location: Walk right prior to reaching Shadowfax. There are two formations under Shelobs Lair, Both Gandalf and Radagast are prominent on the rightmost.

content.description: Pull past a large bulge/roof right of a bolt (crux #1).  Head up and left to a crack in a dihedral.  The crack thins down and provides crux #2, leading to easier climbing above.  The climb is pretty physical and seems to really get your whole body involved at the cruxes.
content.protection: 1 bolt and small to 1" gear to a 3 bolt anchor.  If you want protection before the bolt bring a #3 or #4 and a medium to long sling.
content.location: Far right side.  Head up and right from the top of the right approch trail.  Scrabmle up to a ledge where you will see the lone bolt on a bulge.  This can be easily TRd off the bolts and it is advised to use a .5-1" piece as a directional at the top of the crack.

content.description: Low angle slab climb on the face of the prominent pinnacle in the Middle Earth area. Fairly sustained climbing with the single bolt being plenty of protection for the short face.
content.protection: 1 bolt. Bolted anchors
content.location: Pinnacle lies above the "Out on a whim" climb and beneath the Middle Earth Canyon area.

content.description: Offwidth crack, with notable hand s-crack that gets you off the ground. Found it to be difficult for the grade, although I am not a proficient Offwidth climber.  Crux occurs near the top as crack continue to widen.
content.protection: 3 and larger. Be prepared to walk a 6 if you only have one. Bolt Anchors at top
content.location: One of the last climbs on top of the Middle Earth region. Look for the wide crack the continues to widen at the top.

content.description:
Face climb starts on classic Mission Gorge polished grey slickrock and finishes on classic Mission Gorge sticky orange rock requiring delicate moves.  Apparently going left at the third bolt is slightly easier.  I would recommend straight up, bolt to bolt.

I have heard that there was a variant of LSD enjoyed by our troops in Vietnam back in that time known as Orange Sunshine.  I have no idea if those who named this climb were aware of that, but it is an interesting fact.
content.protection: 4 shiny bolts with rap anchor.
content.location: Middle Earth area.  Head up the trail to the Middle Earth sport climbing area.  Up the steps, and veer right, in a canyon by The Overhangs.  You will see an obvious orange wall on the left side with some bolts.

climbs.name: Nameless to the right of Fools Gold

content.description: Dihedral with nice grippy rock.  The route finishes at the anchor for Fools Gold.
content.protection: Finger crack at apex of dihedral, maybe 1-1.5 inches at the top, somewhat wider down low.  It's not well protected after the top of the dihedral, but the climbing is fairly easy at that point for the last 6 feet or so.
content.location: Obvious dihedral to the right of Fools Gold.  Rap anchors at top of Fools Gold.

content.description: This pitch climbs the face/arrete to the right of Shadowfax. While not the longest most engaging route in Mission gorge I feel it is comparable to many in the vicinity, and is noteworthy enough to list here. The climb involves some decent crimps pinches and palm slapping slopers, with a mantle finish.
content.protection: Top rope from Shadofax anchors.
content.location: Far right on the Easy Rider/Shadowfax formation

content.description: Offwidth at any grade makes the grade feel a little harder. Marranon is rated a little stiffer is you restrain yourself from using hold inside the offwidth crack.
content.protection: Standard rack. Wide Gear. Two bolt anchor.

content.description: Slightly overhanging and crimpy climbing takes you to the top of a pinnacle shaped boulder.  Lead Orthanc (5.8) to establish a bolted toprope anchor for this climb. This is a great climb to finish off the day!
content.protection: Toprope bolts with a rap station, requires slings and locking carabiners.
content.location: Lower Middle Earth.

content.description: Start directly below the rap anchors. A few hard face moves lead to an easy thin crack.
content.protection: Sport anchors
content.location: In between Orange Sunshine and Risky Business

content.description: crimps turn to jugs pretty quick.
content.protection: bolted anchor
content.location: Head up the hill past Shadowfax.  Bruiser Wall will be on your right, just past that around the corner are the overhangs.  Walk up/scramble for anchor set up.

content.description: Awesome jug start to crimps and pinchers.  Go straight up, dont get lured too far left
content.protection: anchor
content.location: Head up the hill past Shadowfax.  Bruiser Wall will be on your right, just past that around the corner are the overhangs.  Walk up/scramble for anchor set up.

content.description: Climb past two bolts to a ledge, transition onto the face and continue up past two more bolts to a rappel station.
content.protection: Four (4) bolt protection. Bolt anchor.

content.description: Climb the left diagonalling fist/hand crack just left of the offwidth. Not much a wide crack climber but feel Art Messier's rating of 5.8+ to be drastically wrong. Definitely felt more in the 5.5-5.6 range.
content.protection: Short gear lead, a #4 in the crack will probably be the only piece you need. Gear anchor up top.
content.location: Below Lower Middle Earth Cyn on the right looking up the trail.

climbs.name: Khazad-dûm
climbs.fa: Ken Cook, Werner Landry, Glaen Kirkwood

content.description: Two definite schools of thought on the start. I led in directly from below being taller, using some dynamic moves and smearing. Partner very delicately came in from left side. Solid reachy hands with good feet in between gaps of blankness. Fun route.
content.protection: 3 bolts, bolted anchors
content.location:
Just right of Dimrill stair. Surprised was not in MP.com already, seemed like a commonly done route.

Right side of Middle earth corridor.

content.description: A reachy start leads to easier climbing above.
content.protection: Bolts / rap anchor.
content.location: Head up left past the pod on your way up Middle Earth.  Just right of the cave/chimney.

content.description: Climbs the face and arete above Gandalf. Starts with a tricky overhang which leads to easier but still sustained climbing.
content.protection: 2 bolts. Bolt Anchor
content.location: On a pinnacle directly above Gandalf in New Middle Earth.

content.description: There's an old pin in the corner.  Go up the tricky corner.   An easier variation goes out right.
content.protection: bolt anchor
content.location: about 20 feet left of Fool's Gold.

content.description: A nice and slopey sport climb which maintains its difficulty without the need for finger popping crimpers.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a rap anchor.  Sporting some upgraded hardware 11/2007.
content.location: In the Middle Earth area, just up and left of the pod, just right of Karmic Relief.  You will see the chalk on the slopers.

content.description: The great hand crack is easily protectable and a pleasure to climb. Lead up on solid jams and good footing to a 2 bolt anchor at top slightly right.  Can set a top rope by walking up around the left passing Shelob's Lair. Class 3 walk-off to climbers left from the bolts.
content.protection: Will take a lot of 1's, 2's and 3's.  Bottom can be protected with ~0.5.  Two bolt anchor on top shared with Radagast.  No chains or rap rings.

content.description: Fun reachy moves lead to easier climbing.
content.protection: 3 bolts. Rap anchor.
content.location: Located in the New Middle Earth (left side of Middle Earth). First route you come across when approaching this wall.  When climbing you'll know you are on the right route when you see the pressed metal tab attached to one of the bolts that says "Fools Gold".

content.description: Hand/fist crack leads to steeper climbing on uneven blocks.  Exit to the right towards anchors for Gandalf's (Grandpa's) dihedral.  Crux is probably the hands/fist crack, which can be awkward to jam.
content.protection: Small - medium pro.  Use bolt anchor on Gandalf's (Grandpa's) dihedral.
content.location: Located in New Middle Earth, to the right of Feces Fetish and to the left of Gandalf's (Grandpa's) Dihedral.

content.description: Easy Rider is the first bolted climb you see after hiking up the Climber's Loop trail from the South kiosk. Climb up and left from the base of the rock past three bolts to a ledge. Traverse right then up again to the anchor.
content.protection: Four (4) bolt protection. Two bolt anchor. A TR may be set up by accessing the anchor from the back side of the rock.

content.description: Left leaning diagonal crack on the right side of the middle Earth area. Awkward feet for a new trad leader, nothing to crazy though, fun climb.
content.protection: Small-medium cams, bolts at the top.
content.location: 15ft to the Right of Dimrill Stair.

content.description: A good line in Upper Middle Earth. Straightforward crack climbing for the beginner. Great route to teach hand and foot jamming techniques. Splits a prominently orange face.
content.protection: Standard rack, Gear anchor
content.location: 20 ft downhill of large Offwidth Crack "Orc"

content.description: Got tape? Climb up this short very textured hand crack that widens a bit near the top. Continue up to the climbers left to a bolt anchor.
content.protection:
- Cams: BD #0.5, #0.75, #1 or equivalent.

- Gear anchor. (I used 2 tricams in horizontal cracks, BD #3, and slung plants)

- Possible use and re-direct of

Sam I Am

bolted anchor left of top-out

content.description: Stay just right of Straight outta Sitka.  Originally rejoined Sitka after 15 feet, but you can actually go straight up on stem & sidepulls.
content.protection: bolt anchor
content.location: 10 feet left of Fool's Gold

content.description:
Awesome sport climb in the Middle Earth of Mission Gorge.  Start far right of the first bolt.  An easy traverse up/left leads to the first bolt.  From there a difficult traverse left, then up to the second bolt.  Mostly straight up from there.  If you like crimper foot holds and almost nonexistent hand holds, this climb is for you.  Foot sequence is important, so this climb will make you think!  In my opinion the crux is all the way between clipping the first bolt and clipping the last bolt.

This climb is referred to by some as "Chrome Dome".  You will know you are on this climb when you come across a name tag on the last bolt that says "Big Kahuna, 5.10D".  Whatever you call it, it is a fun and safe climb to lead.
content.protection: Four bolts plus rap anchor.
content.location: Just across the canyon from Orange Sunshine.  First climb on the next formation just uphill from The Overhangs.

content.description: Climb up a thin crack into a pod. Climb out of the pod to the climbers left, and continue up a sloping arete following the crack to the top of the formation.
content.protection: Standard rack. Two bolt anchor. TRing this route will generate a lot of rope tension due the distance to the anchor.

content.description: Difficult thin face climbing past one bolt eases to a sloping ledge.  Continue past another bolt on easier face moves to reach the anchor.
content.protection: Two (2) bolt protection. Two bolt anchor. The anchor may be reached to set up a TR from the back side of the climb.

content.description: Short, but sustained for the length, with good rock.  Posting from distant memory (TRed it once over a decade ago; will update if needed when I next go to Middle Earth).  I think there's an ancient fixed pin, but this would be a very serious lead: I'm not sure any other gear can be placed - if so, stances would be very difficult - and the landing is pretty bad.  Maybe it was originally done as an aid climb.  Start off of a 2' rock at the base (ground start would be harder than 11), and do several burly and technical lieback moves.
content.protection: Trad anchor of small gear.  I recall fiddling for a good ten minutes to get a decent set up of three pieces.
content.location: Across the gully from Anduril.  Can be accessed by scrambling from the uphill (east) end of the formation, or by leading any of the routes on the formation, such as Glamdring.

content.description: Getting on this climb is the crux. Climb up a shallow dihedral to gain a ledge. Continue climbing up and left past three bolts to the anchor.
content.protection: Four (4) bolt protection. Two bolt anchor. Rappel station.

content.description: Climb the face between Sam I Am and Dimrill Stair.  Continue up a few finger jams to the Sam I Am anchor.
content.protection: TR from bolted rap anchor atop Sam I Am.
content.location: The face left of Dimrill Stair (hand crack). About the 6th route up the Middle Earth corridor.

content.description:
Technical, blocky lieback moves a few feet up take you to slightly better hands above.  Crux is probably from 3-8 ft up.

Staying left near top keeps you on route and takes you to last bolt; moving right allows you to bail onto Dwarrowdelf to finish (finger sized pro if needed).

Surprised this hasn't been added in; it's obviously frequently TRed, sometimes led.
content.protection: 3 Bolts.  Well protected.  Bolts at top slightly to right; rap rings over to left.  The right bolts seemed better for the TR, but I could be misremembering.
content.location: On the right side of the Middle Earth Lower Canyon, between Dwarrowdelf and Khazaddum.

content.description: Short route with low crux that leads to easier climbing.
content.protection: 2 bolts with optional 1-2" pro in horizontal crack at midway point.  2 bolt rap anchor.
content.location: Left side of the New Middle Earth area (far left side of Middle Earth). Start at orange face on hillside slope. Both bolts and crack visible from ground.
